page.title: 05Communications
page.content:
The most important road in our area is the A1. It is dual carriageway here but many parts of it are motorway. We did a traffic count for 15 minutes in the mid morning of Thursday 23rd May 1985 and the results were: Northbound 302 vehicles and Southbound 315 vehicles. This means over 40 vehicles use the road every minute!
When we looked at bus services in 4 square kilometres we were surprised to discover that 213,682 buses passed through them in a year. The transport manager who brought a bus to school for us to look at said that a new bus would cost between Â£60,000 and Â£100,000.
